 How The Webby Awards Work
  Now in its 11th year, the Webby is the premier international award honoring excellence on the Internet. This year the Webby Awards received more than 8,000 nominations from 60 countries and all 50 states. Learn how the 
Webby Awards work and why winners have to watch their tongues. To view this year's nominees, including HowStuffWorks, click here.
 Also at HowStuffWorks
 
How Wireless Power Works - Unless you are particularly organized and good with tie
wrap, you probably have a few dusty power cord tangles around your home. Find
out how methods of wireless power transmission could cut the clutter or even
lead to clean sources of electricity.

    How Tsunamis Work - 
The terrible destruction of the tsunami that
struck Sumatra and other islands in the area
on December 26, 2004, showed that tidal waves are not merely the stuff of
disaster movies. Since then, other tsunamis have struck, including recently in
the Solomon Islands.
Learn about tsunamis and how scientists try to predict their arrival before
it's too late.  
How Space Stations Work - For years, people have dreamed of having a permanent space
station in orbit around Earth. The United States
and Russia
have had orbiting space stations since 1971 and are now cooperating with other
nations to build the International Space Station, a place that will maintain a
permanent human presence in space. Find out how space stations work and discover
what the future holds.
   
This Week's Video 
How Hurricanes Work - Summer brings beautiful weather and pleasant days outdoors,
but for some parts of the world, it also brings hurricanes. In this video from
HowStuffWorks, learn how hurricanes work and why storms such as Hurricane
Katrina are so deadly.
